Reviews.Title: Good Camera for my first one.
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews for these camera's will drive you crazy. This was my first purchase of any type of security camera.What I needed: the ability to monitor and capture video of my back porch, decent night vision a must.What I got: exactly that.Setup was easy.  If you're not technical at all I can see how some new terms might trip you up. Get the manual in PDF from foscam.us, the english isn't great but it walks you through getting it on wireless, setting up the external access (from the internet), and many of the other functions. It found my wireless network, i supplied the WPA2 pass phrase and it was connected. My camera will be about 15ft from my wireless router through two walls, frame rate viewing on my network is better than i expected. Frame over the internet isn't bad, a little jumpy but you can clearly make out what is happening.Installation: This camera requires 5V of DC power. Make sure you think about this when you place your camera. I had power in the ceiling of my porch and felt comfortable adding in a hidden box (yeah i know electricians but it's diagrammed so any subsequent homeowner will know it's there).  I have read mixed reviews about AIR802 splitter. Some say it works fine, others say the voltage drops after 10 feet and the camera won't stay on. Foscam sells a POE injector and splitter with selectable power switch to accommodate the 5V. that will set you back $50.  Standard POE is 48V!!! You should use a splitter with selectable power output!Email, DDNS, Recording settings: The setup for these was easy. For those that don't know, DDNS is how you will be able to access your camera remotely. I have my own domain and know my email settings by heart. If you want to use Gmail it has options for that built in. Yahoo, Hotmail, Outlook.com etc should work as well. Mine was emailing me within seconds of hitting Submit to save the settings.Operation: I really liked the scheduler for motion alarms.  You can adjust the sensitivity as well which is great because at setting 7 light wind blowing my trees was setting it off. Picture quality of the video isn't bad, just remember this isn't your HD Video cam or smart phone. ***Be warned it records in .AVI.***  iPhones will not play .AVI files. Night recording it easily sees to the end of my porch, which is just under 30ft.RECORDING: My biggest gripe. It only records while you have IE open and logged into the camera! So i had to write a custom script to upload videos automatically to my webspace via FTP. One way around this for the non-technical is to get a drop box account.  The videos are generally 50MB so a free dropbox account can hold around 2500 videos. Set it to save the recording (under User settings) to your dropbox synch folder. the FTP portion only uploads the same pictures it emails. Which I find kind of useless. The thing that i didn't like IE opens the page for the camera on startup (add a shortcut to the url in your startup folder) However it doesn't login automatically. So if your computer reboots for updates, you're not recording.Durability: My camera sat on my kitchen table facing a backdoor until I had time to mount it. It was knocked off twice, the second time broke the antennae off. Looking in the hole it appears a piece of metal connecting the external portion of the antennae has broken. However it still receives the wireless signal just fine and never skipped a beat. No reboot or anything. Mounted this shouldn't be an issue.Overall I'm very pleased with the camera.  MAKE SURE YOU GET THE WIDE ANGLE VERSION! 3.6MM lens!  I can't imagine having less viewable area than I have now. So the 6MM, 8MM, and 12MM lenses would only be useful to me in confined spaces. Also make sure you plan for power correctly.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: TJH
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great buy. It did ship as FI8904W with a FI8903W sticker, but since there are 2 lens options, just make sure it is marked 3.6mm on the box. The picture is very clear and night vision works excellent. I get a activex error when trying to use IE, but Firefox works great(browser of choice anyway).  Wireless seems to be strong and picks up alot of networks I don't see with any of my computers. I will be mounting it approx 120 feet from my house and have no doubt it should connect up just fine.Very easy to setup using the following steps without their software. 1. connect hardwired to your router and login to your router interface. Look under devices to get the ip address. 2. open browser and enter IP address in the url addres (192.168.x.x) this will take you to the login page. Login:admin, pw: leave blank. **IMPORTANT** click the correct login button(1 for IE, and one for all other browsers). 3. under "user settings" change pw for admin account 3. under "wireless settings",scan and connect to your wireless - Now is a good time to set a static IP under "network settings" 4. unplug network cable and reboot the camera. repeat step 2 to verify wireless working. Motion detection alarm works great with email notification. Haven't set up any ftp process yet, but will play with it soon.

Reviews.Title: No more purple trees!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: These cameras are a lot better than the first versions, the trees are green instead of purple. The ircut filter was a great improvement, I dont have to change the brightness/contrast every morning and evening like the first ones.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: INFOWARS
Reviews.Content: They need quity control on their products. The bracket aside from being very cheaply made, was tapped wrong so the threads do not work. Lucky for me I have a Trendnet tvip110 I bought from Amazon that was dead within a month I used the bracket from. These cameras could be a lot better if more care went into manufacturing.

Reviews.Title: Contrast bug seems to affect all recent MJPEG Foscams
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received this camera from Amazon a few days ago. The box was labeled FI8904W, 2.8mm wide angle lens. It looks more like the 3.6mm lens with a viewing angle of 60-70 degrees. The camera has no problems in low light (indoors, at night even with IR on), but in moderate to bright daylight at 640x480 resolution, the video stream quickly dies. The Foscam forums suggest that this problem affects a variety of MJPEG Foscams, and that there is currently no fix. Hopefully it will be fixed by a firmware update in the future. In the meantime, I suggest avoiding MJPEG Foscams.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: Wullow Still
Reviews.Content: Update: After 6 months, the camera is completely dead. Apparently some part of the power supply quit. I previously gave it a fair review, in spite of the quirks I listed below...My disappointments are:It was frustrating getting the wireless configuration to work. Apparently the device doesn't support WEP.The "wide angle" lens is a fish-eye type. The image size is 640x480.You have to use IE and keep it running if you want any recording to happen.Motion detection seems to be highly-biased toward the center of the image.Motion compensation seems to do nothing. I get false alarms when the sun goes behind the clouds; yet someone can walk right in the center of the picture and not trigger an alarm.Recording does not start fast enough. If someone walks quickly enough across the field of view, the recording will miss them.You can't control the length of alarm-generated recordings. It always records for a full minute.

Reviews.Title: Tech Support
Reviews.Author: jreink01
Reviews.Content: Ralph Mendez I purchased the Foscam 18904W Outdoor Camera about a week ago. Set up was relatively easy except that I was confused on how to configure it so I could see the camera over the internet. I called tech support and they had this up and running in no time. The techs name that assisted me was Ralph. Other than that, the camera appears to be well made. I still have this camera inside, I wanted to get it up and running before I mounted it. I will update this after about a month of having this installed outside.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: B.Myers "USA Traveller"
Reviews.Content: After checking out various products, I purchased this camera to monitor my driveway.  The price was decent and although I was put off by all the negative reviews for this product, I took the plunge.I found the software easy to set up and got the camera working in wireless mode very quickly.  However, after that, everything went down hill.  The physical camera has a large wire coming out of the back when a small, thin wire is all that is needed.  This is a terrible design flaw, because in addition to the power line, there is a cable for reset and another cable for the LAN interconnect, both of which are only needed one time, at setup.  You have to either drill a very big hole in your wall to get this cable through, or you can leave the two unnecessary cables exposed to the weather and run the thin power cable through your wall or window, as I did.The mounting bracket is cheesy and broke right away when I tried to mount the camera to it.  Fortunately, I had another laying around and used that.After finally getting the camera installed on the side of the building, I aimed it and then went inside to make some final adjustments to the contrast and brightness.  When I changed the settings for those items, the camera went blank and stopped communicating altogether.  I took the whole thing down, ran through the setup again and it worked fine.  But after reinstalling the camera on the mounting bracket it does not communicate or show the picture at all.I have already spent too much time messing with this thing.  In retrospect, I should have paid more attention to the negative reviews that this product has garnered.  I'm sending it back for a refund and get something with better reviews.  I know it won't be a Foscam, though.

Reviews.Title: Not as wide angle as I hoped but works well outdoors
Reviews.Author: Laurence C. Brevard
Reviews.Content: I have four other Foscam cameras but they are meant for indoor operation.I got this to mount outside to monitor my detached garage.For some reason they sent me an FI8904W instead of the FI8903W that I ordered but it seems to be equivalent (and actually a bit more expensive).My only issue is that I'd really like even more of a wide angle. The box indicates it came with an optional 3.6mm "wide angle" lens but it's still narrower than I really need.I got used to the pan / tilt function of the other cameras and need to rethink where this one is mounted.Otherwise I'm very used to the software interface by now. It works well with camera applications on my iOS (Netcam4, Netcam8, LiveCams Pro) and Android (tinyCam Monitor Pro) devices. It also does server push to Chrome and Safari.The worst operation is with the ActiveX control used in Internet Explorer so I just avoid that.I also wish there was a time date overlay like I have on my Panasonic IP cameras.In the end this does what I need for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for the money
Reviews.Author: Mark Filip
Reviews.Content: Camera is small/compact but does a really good job for the price point.  It is a standard VGA (640x480) but, like others have reported, the color is actually much better now.Kaspersky reports that the software that comes with the camera has a virus but I'm not sure if that's because the software 'scans' for other cameras or if it's really infected.I have several high end cameras and this one, although lower end, does quite well with daytime and nighttime critter watching.  The only minor drawback is that, although designed for outdoor use, the extra cables need to be wrapped up in plastic, to protect them from the elements, seems like there should be a better design for that somehow.The mounting bracket/brace that comes with this unit is fairly useless and extremely cheaply made, so you'd be better off buying a small camera tripod. I have the gorilla flexible camera mount and it works great.  I can use the legs to 'wrap' around tree limbs, etc.

Reviews.Title: Good luck getting this thing to work
Reviews.Author: Toxic Frog
Reviews.Content: Followed all the directions.Worked fine when connected through wire.Getting the wireless connection to work required lots of web sleuthing not covered in the manual. Finally got it up and running.Unplugged the camera, and moved it, wireless worked. Even managed to log in via a browser to see the video feed (which also required internet sleuthing to figure out).Then I moved it to where I actually need the camera, and there's no video feed. I can log in to the camera, but no video. OK, I'll just start over, I suppose. Hooked it up AGAIN with a wire to reinstall from scratch (for the 4th time), and now there's no video even over a wired connection.The setup on this piece of crap is so unintuitive that I want to smash it. I am not technically stupid by any means. I can follow directions and figure things out, but good lord, this piece of junk has the WORST documentation in the history of mankind. AVOID. If you want a wireless security monitor, I can all but guarantee this one will not work for you unless you understand every technical detail of networks and routers.If you want a wired monitor, it will probably work at first, but who knows if it will keep working if you ever have to unplug it.AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: Feb 2013 purchase - Faulty from the get-go
Reviews.Author: E. Brundick
Reviews.Content: Camera was easy to set up but the problems surfaced quickly; the camera goes through what appears to be a frequent reboot, from the eyes of a trained Linux sysadmin (I understand these cams all run some sort of uClinux-type firmware) it looks like it's going through a reboot procedure; software loses access to the camera, port 80 rejects connection but the camera still pings, less than 30 seconds later the pings stop, short while after that they start again and the camera works properly.  Wait a couple minutes, rinse & repeat... This happens very consistently on both WiFi and Ethernet (even with wifi completely disabled).  Using a static IP address that was confirmed unused before assigning it, so I know it's not an IP conflict or network error.FYI, the latest firmware available for this on the Foscam website is 2 minor revisions *behind* what shipped with the camera.  I did not try downgrading its firmware.Just sent the thing back.  Not going to futz with it.This is my 2nd cheap chinese IP camera; first is an Agasio A603W, a bit nicer than this (and it works) but slightly narrower angle lens; I went ahead and ordered another one of those to fulfill the job this was going to perform, I will just have to move it back a bit to cover the area.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price
Reviews.Author: allegroBob
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera for my home. It's small but produces a terrific picture.  The installation was a bit tricky but one installed it works great!

Reviews.Title: Hard to install
Reviews.Author: Go4dat
Reviews.Content: The camera does have good picture day and night. I put up 3 of them and 1 is already bad. I spent hours on the phone with tech support

Reviews.Title: waste of time and money
Reviews.Author: jbsnet "these bleeds?"
Reviews.Content: Pretty much a waste of time and money.Unit works GREAT in the same room as my wireless router or AP. Drops connections as soon as you setup outside. It's truly an awful product.

Reviews.Title: ok cams for the price
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: works fine for the price. I do not run windows on pc's so it took some time to find the best linux progrom to use but settled on motion. have ordered more foscams of different models since this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but keeps disconnecting which makes it unusable
Reviews.Author: GALA
Reviews.Content: Impossible to keep connected either via ethenet or wi-fi, so you can not relay on it. Pity, so far good experience with Foscam, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Billiardman
Reviews.Content: I tried 3 of this specific model. They all worked intermittently. I returned 2 and trashed the 3rd. The Agasio 603W is a better choice. Foscam owns Agasio. The Foscam cameras have 5 volt power supplies. Agasio has 12 volt power supply with a 4 mm lens. Other Foscam models seem to work fine. This model has a firmware issue with no updates available.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Raymond Cheng
Reviews.Content: Useless piece of crap.  The wireless doesn't work on my model, and I realized it too late to return it.

Reviews.Title: lasted about ten minuets
Reviews.Author: George A. Moranian "n1naz"
Reviews.Content: Plugged it in tried it out 10 minuets later stopped working, while it was working it would freeze and reboot when subjected to outdoor lighting. Sent back

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I spoke with Harry Foster.He went through the set up on my Camera and was excellent!I highly recommend. These guys are amazing!

Reviews.Title: I have many of the older foscam's but this model needs a lot of work
Reviews.Author: Michel J. Ferris
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these cam's and installed in where one of my older ones had been.  The older one laster over 5 years before it began to leak during rain storms.Amaxingly it still works but the lense gets fogged by the moister in the cam.  After installing the 18903 I was impressed by the picture.  It was true color and not faded out like all the old ones.  I went ahead and purchased another thinking that one at a time I would replace all the older camera's with the new true color ones.  Before the second one arrived I started having issues with my new 18903. It worked fine for a few days then it started to come up with all the images in a blue color and as the day went on the cam would disapeared from site on the interenet and on my home network.  The only way to get it back was to power off and on the camera.I of course thought it was defective so I waited for the next cam to come in and installed it where the first one was, returning the original camera for a refund.  With in days the new one was doing the same thing as the first one.  Within a week it would not turn on al all.Once again, giving Foscam the benifit of the doubt I retuned the cam and got another one......same thing.  Up for a while then had to be reset by powering down and back up.I now have returned the last of the 18903's and have gone to Agasio 603's. I know that this company is really Foscam but the camera is very differant.  So far the first cam has been installed for a week with constant service. I was going to say no issues but this camera does have one issue.  In bright light it ever so slightly shifts from one brightness to another.  It is notisable but it is something that I can live with. It has the true colors as did the 18903 when it was working, which is the reason I got into changing the older working cams.  True color is great!  I have just ordered 2 more Agasio 603's and I hope my luck holds out.

Reviews.Title: not the best camera for large areas.
Reviews.Author: Gregg D. Schlaman "schla"
Reviews.Content: covers OK during the day,  but at night the vision is poor since it doesn't have as many LED's as the 8906...

Reviews.Title: first one i received was broken out of box. new one works great
Reviews.Author: russell robinson
Reviews.Content: cheap antenna, was broken out of the box. didnt connect to my laptop or my Desktop or network. spent hours trying to communicate with it. I have windows 7.. you cant exchange it for another, so if you order this and doesnt work,,have to go through the hassle of returning it..so dont even bother!update 5-7-13. sent the bad one back, reordered another unit. that unit worked great. dont use the CD or the IP camera tool that comes with the camera. I think that was part of the issues with the first one.I followed the simple directions from a review on this site. and it worked great! camera works as described. colors are very good. better than i expected, from some reviews. nite vision works well too..i plan to order another one.

Reviews.Title: Very basic outdoor IP cam
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth Foscam product purchase. All five show signs of poor quality control. While most Foscam devices appear to offer much bang for the buck, the truth is they typically have some compromise or quality control problem that causes problems. This device is no different. My sample looked great with the extruded aluminum case, but had very poor wireless range, out of focus and hazy daylight images and just awful nighttime images. For what I paid and what I expected, I'm not disappointed, but they could do better. My experience with Foscam is spotty at best. You may get a good one or a bad one.

Reviews.Title: Decent picture resolution
Reviews.Author: E. Solch
Reviews.Content: I like the wide angle lens, and the infra-red works pretty well. I can see at night up to 60' from the camera location.

Reviews.Title: foscam wide angle camera
Reviews.Author: 57cheby
Reviews.Content: camera came with bad eithernet cable but once customer service helped me figure that out it was no problem. Customer service conneted to my computer and hooked everything up.  Calvin was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JOSEPH
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to monitor the house. The video on this camera is excellent. I did have one problem setting up the camera. I couldn't get the camera to record to the hartd drive. Contacted Foscam customer service and talked to Sandra. She took about 10 minutes to solve the problem. Camera works just a advertised and Sandra provided outstanding service. Would reccommend this camer and Foscam customer service to anyone who needs to monitor there home.

Reviews.Title: No usable outdoor reception
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Ross
Reviews.Content: I think Foscam makes good products and they have very good tech support.  I am very happy with my 5 indoor wireless Foscam cameras.  I disregarded several negative feedback comments on the range of this camera.  I would have saved a lot of trouble if I had accepted the information and passed on this one.  I have had such positive experience with Foscam, I thought maybe they were having an isolated experience.  However, there was no spot anywhere outside my house that I could get any thing but spotty, momentary reception.  Inside the house was okay.  So back it goes to the world's best seller, Amazon, and I have already ordered another indoor Foscam F18910W.  I will be watching for Foscam's next attempt at an outdoor wireless camera.  They have to do better than this one.

Reviews.Title: Good camera and good color.
Reviews.Author: JW "wise1"
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived a few days ago.  Tested ok in the house.  Put it up outside in permenant location this am.  Good picture with good color.  Problem with the software.  Talked with Foscam and they said Microsoft changed something in the IE browser in april which is causing the ActiveX error and the certificate error.  Said to fix the problem need to set the PC date to prior Feb 2012, log into camera and then change the PC date back to the current date.  That fixed the problem.  If problems show up I will update.

Reviews.Title: Excellent IP Camera with Night Vision
Reviews.Author: DILSHAN BOTEJU
Reviews.Content: Having recently purchased this Camera from Amazon, i am very happy with the product. The image quality and construction of the unit is very solid and meant to last.Set-up was a little frustrating as some basic instructions were not provided in the manual. Example, the factory set IP is not mentioned anywhere although examples are provided. The Manufacturer expects every user to do the set-up through their software I guess. But a professional on IP cameras will want to loginto the cam through explorer and do the settings. But in this case it will be difficult because IP iS NOT clearly mentioned.This is only a minor set back considering the image quality and solid construction.

Reviews.Title: First look at FI8903W is great!
Reviews.Author: John Curtis "jgcurtis"
Reviews.Content: Got my new 8903 a couple of hours ago. This has IR CUT and other "improvements".I fired it up and was happy with my first look. Have a number of earlier models. The daytime video is very well exposed with factory setting (6/4 outdoor). Greens are green. Box says 3.6mm lens but I find it slightly narrower than an 8918 3.6mm I compared it with. But a whole lot better (if you want wide angle)than 6mm in 8905. I'll add to this review as necessary.Only con I see is that the antenna on the rear is hard to tighten with my open end wrench.Update:I obtained a thinner end wrench, worked fine, happy with camera.Since then I have reordered this item three times. All three shipments contained an FI8904W in a box with FI8904W printed on it and a small white sticker saying it was an FI8903W. All three were returned with Amazon supplied label. A chat to Customer Service in India showed these persons, while very polite and normally helpful, have no authority beyond a refund and send back authorization.I believe Amazon might ship an unlimited number of wrongly classified items without the man/woman/machine in the warehouse ever getting the word. They said they would get back in 2-3 days.In the meantime, I've ordered a similar one from X10 (90 degree wide angle) which looks interesting but has had spotty reviews. But their shipping charges will knock you out if you're a PRIME customer.I have a number of occasions in the past where the lens FP was not what the ad or the box specified.Moral, when you buy a Foscam camera product, check before using to see the item is as ordered.

Reviews.Title: Flawed
Reviews.Author: Casual buyer
Reviews.Content: Warning: Do some research on the web before pliuging .I ended up returning this after almost  a day working on this product.  It worked while testing it beside your PC (indoor). but when I installed it outside, video stops working after few minutes.  Reset it and it will only work again for a few minutes.  Bring it indoor and it works flawlessly.  Only good about this product is video quality and video angle.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Wireless Connectivity
Reviews.Author: Serenity
Reviews.Content: The wireless connectivity on these cameras is very very bad.  The will not stay connected especially if you have more than one camera.  I don't see how it would ever be possible to connect four of these cameras wirelessly at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera (UPDATED) (UPDATE #2)
Reviews.Author: Tim "Tim"
Reviews.Content: (UPDATE #2: FOLLOW-UP (NEGATIVE))(UPDATE #1: READ MY IMPRESSIONS AFTER A MONTH OF USE BELOW)I've had this running for a few days now so I thought I'd give an early review.I have it set up outside under an eve in my carport. It's been in the mid 20's at night here and the camera is running fine. So far the camera is working well. The set up was pretty strait forward. I didn't even look at the user manual or put in the CD that cam with it. My experience with IP camera's is that they all install with a little tech know-how. You HAVE to know how to access your router settings. If you don't, from what I've read, Foscam support is pretty helpful.I'll get strait to the pro's and con's:Pro's:1) Semi-functional night time infrared viewing.2) Email alarm works well. You can adjust the sensitivity. Have not tired the FTP, but I assume it works fine.3) Affordable4) Easy web UI with some options to adjust image quality wherever you are.Con's:1) Not exactly "wide angle." Although it does have a decent viewing angle. Just don't expect anything super wide.2) Resolution is lacking. Max is 640 x 480. Image is slightly fuzzy/grainy. Suits my needs well enough though.3) Dongle is a little awkward with power and Ethernet all attached in one spot. No option to just have a power cord for clean installation.4) IR at night tends to wash out things directly in front of it. Haven't tried the "IR cut" feature yet. Not exactly sure where it is on the UI. I have it set to "outdoor" mode.UPDATE #1:I've used this in two locations in 1 month. The first was at home where temps are about 35 degrees. It dropped to the mid-twenties at night for about a week strait as well. I had sun and rain and everything worked fine. I recently transferred it to a cabin in the mountains where it's in the 20's and 30's and few feet of snow on the ground. This is where it has showed its flaws. The IR gives a false alarm when it switched over in the morning (AND SOMETIMES NIGHT). The camera also flickers quite a bit when the sun comes out and reflects off the snow, causing more false alarms. After going to the Foscam forums, this seems to be a common complaint. The camera has no way of knowing the IR cut is giving a false alarm. As for the flickering, the only option is to downsize the viewing resolution. The highest level resolution of 640 x 480 is nothing to write home about. Having to use the smaller 320 x 240 makes me feel like I'm using '90's tech. The flickering can best be described as a dynamic contract getting confused, but as far as I can tell, there is no dynamic contrast feature built in.So now I'm using the 320 x 240 resolution and the alarm sensitivity set at 1 (out of 10; 10 being the highest). I still get false alarms at this setting.All of the firmware is at the latest revisions, which was supposed to stop the flickering. But it obviously hasn't. Again, the issue only happens when there is sun and snow present (i.e.- a lot of light variance quickly). I'll add one star if they can fix it via firmware update.UPDATE #2:I've been using this for a few months now and have had a recurring issue where the alarm and the night-vision (IR) conflict. When then IR comes on OR off in the AM/PM the alarm triggers and sends me an email. Very annoying. I ended up turning off the alarm during the hours that the IR would tun on/off, which sort of defeats the purpose of a motion alarm for security purposes. I emailed customer support about this and they recommend I hard reset the device, which is a no-go for me since it's managed remotely. All firmware is up to date but I have seen that this is a common problem. From my experience, any time customer support tells you to "hard reset" their product, it's usually a sign that there is no fix. -1 star.The alarm also triggers when the sun comes and goes, even at low sensitivity. Seems the dynamic contract isn't smart enough to compensate. The work-around is to lower the resolution to the smallest setting, which is not ideal since the resolution is already pretty low.So mainly, my gripes are due to the alarm functionality. Turn it off and it's an OK product. I will look elsewhere for my next IP Webcam with alarm functionality for my next purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr TV
Reviews.Content: This is a really good stationary camera. ( stationary = non P/T/Z) The FI8903W is the better of the cameras. Had to send the 2-FI8904W back because of fuzzy picture.Seems that you can't get the FI8903W's any more. Good product now extinct.They call this wide angle but it's not that wide for sure.All in all - it's a good camera and the support, when needed, from Foscam has been very good.

Reviews.Title: Wrong item in box
Reviews.Author: Daniel Druker "- Dan"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the F18903W - which is the wide angle version of this family of cameras - to use as a backup camera for my Airstream trailer.  The other versions are -04W and -05W - which have longer lenses.The box I received was marked F18903W - correct.The camera inside was a F18904W - so not the wide angle version I ordered.I've sent an email to Foscam asking if they want me to return to Amazon or they will replace.

Reviews.Title: it works how it supposed to for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ryder
Reviews.Content: Ive had it for almost a year, still up and running, to run the program on your laptop or PC isnt really user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Don't rely on the wireless reception
Reviews.Author: Martin Halstead
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera when wired.  However, the wireless reception capabilities are pathetic.  I can't get more than 30 feet from the wireless router before signal become unreliable.  None of my other wireless devices ( Android  tablets, I-phones, squeezeboxes etc.) have this problem, and work comfortably at least 50 feet from the router.Addendum:  Got a large high gain antenna for this camera.  The wireless reception improved somewhat, but is still glitchy and very limited in range. This is really not practical as a wireless camera.  Reduced rating by one star.

Reviews.Title: Poor Customer Service
Reviews.Author: M. Pittman "joozu"
Reviews.Content: Just called to ask a question before I bought the product. Fell asleep waiting on hold so long. Called again and finally got someone. Lady was very short with me from the start. Definetly not buying a Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Simple, easy to use , Great night vision.
Reviews.Author: Kiser
Reviews.Content: These are good cameras, and for the price. Feel very sturdy in your handAnd the installation went easy.web config is a snap.

Reviews.Title: meh
Reviews.Author: D. Hayes "evilpentaxuser"
Reviews.Content: received camera, tried to setup, spent hours trying to have work correctly. read instructions that came with it to make it work. camera would show a picture, but blurry, tried as wide area, still blurry, tried to see what actually was in focus, only worked within 3 ft, returned for refund, PDF manual said was fixed focused, did not work at all with MS IE browser. web site too slow for software, I use to have dial up internet, it was that slow for software, worse, software was corrupt zip file from web site. as for IR LED, since when are they red when lighted up, held finger over light sensor, and red LED lights came on.  might work for others, but before buying any Foscam camera, try to download software from their web site first. surprised to see that this product no longer available oddly at this time.  last, as for wireless connection, would not work even 5 ft from router. I have 3 computers that work around the house just fine on same router.

ProductInfo.Name: Foscam WIDE ANGLE FI8903W Network Wireless IP Camera with IR CUT, upgraded Version. Outdoor - Silver
